intro: Moquilea leucosepala, commonly known as the white-headed moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Moquilea leucosepala is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
